response.answer_text: Self-awareness is exactly what it says it is. It is awareness of something you consider to be a self. What is a self? That’s a bit more complicated. Generally, people think that a human being is a self, and that the self contained in that human being’s body is whatever they consider to be part of themselves. The problem comes when you consider something to be a part of yourself that you are not aware of, or you are aware of something within your consciousness, but you don’t consider it to be a part of yourself. For example, there are thoughts that individuals have that they are not aware of. These thoughts often motivate actions or even take control of the body for a while. Are those actions part of the self, even though the self is not aware of the thought processes that motivate or manage those actions? Behaviors such as addictions are a good example of automatic behaviors that many people consciously don’t want to engage in, yet they do despite their will. Then there is the awareness of other entities within the self. Often these other entities are perceived as intruders within consciousness. Are they a part of the self because they are only perceived by the individual, or do they represent an awareness of outside entities that have somehow, psychically become evident to the individual’s consciousness? So a self can contain parts that the person is not aware of and can also exclude consciousness that appears to belong to a different self that only that person is aware of. My definition of self includes all that I am conscious of and also parts of me that I am not aware of but can infer by observing my behavior. So all my behavior that I do not consciously want to do, but my body does, I consider to be part of my self, even though I am not aware of the thought processes that motivate and manage those behaviors. Self-awareness is then awareness of the parts of myself that I can consciously observe. There is more to myself that I cannot be aware of. I do my best to try to infer the motivations and to understand my own behavior by observing my actions, but much of what I consider to be myself is mysterious to me and can’t be directly observed. I also have experiences where I feel like I am channeling some other entity, but I believe these experiences come from the other parts of myself that I am generally not aware of. It feels like something else is controlling me, but I believe that the something else is actually parts of my brain I cannot observe. Self-awareness includes both direct observation of my thinking processes as well as indirect observation of my thinking processes that I cannot directly observe. I observe my own behavior to get information about my thinking processes that I cannot directly be aware of. I consider all the actions and behaviors of my body to be a part of myself. I think of my life as an attempt to integrate the different thinking processes that occur within my body, even though I can’t directly observe all those thinking processes. My self-awareness includes both direct observation of my thinking as well as observation of my behavior in order to infer the thinking processes contained within my body that I can’t directly observe.

Self-a·ware·ness (noun): conscious knowledge of one’s own character, feelings, motives, and desires. This is a phrase that is rarely talked about in our culture and it is tremendously important! “Way too many people are going to spend 30–40 years of their life trying to check the boxes of the things that they’re not good at and waste a fuck load of time and lose.” ~ Gary Vaynerchuck. When someone asks who are you? can you honestly answer that question? Deep in your core, deep in your soul and deep in your heart do you know who you are and why you do what you do everyday? Most people don’t know who the fuck they are and in the chaos of their lives they stop caring about figuring it out. The above quote by Gary Vaynerchuck exemplifies the first reason you should. Most people end up chasing positions, accomplishments and dreams in fields they are innately weak at. Some people truly believe the path they’re on is the best one for them, and a large percentage have mistakenly deluded their perception of themselves and the reality around them. Everybody has a certain skill set and expertise, yet we all think we’re Dorothy from the Wizard of Oz and end up going down a path that looks pretty and fascinating, but really isn’t right for us. This has become the biggest lie we ever tell is to ourselves. After 5 years of hustling and grinding through basketball I became relatively successful within that field. Eventually, I moved away from the sport and stopped playing. I did some self reflection and decided fashion and design was the path I was gravitating towards. Some months later I figured out that I was fucking delusional. I was chasing a dream and passion that wasn’t even mine. I love clothing and have a deep appreciation for design and architecture, but after truly seeing where my heart lay I saw it was a field that I had no experience or skill in, and:Didn’t want that badly, thus making it a weakness.I realised this through a conversation with a very close person in my life — my mother. She reminded me of who I was and what I was great at. With that, I went all in on my strengths. That is how you are reading this, because one of those strengths happens to be is right here on this page — attempting to empower people to positive change through creative written content. I honestly believe with all my heart and soul I can change your life right here on this page, right now. But how did I figure that out and how can you do it? Find the 5 people who you trust and know very well and get them to tell you the truth. Confide in them your feelings, problems and aspirations, then shut up, and listen. If that doesn’t work, or your still unsure. Go all in and do those personality tests and buy that book. STUDY WHO YOU ARE. Before I conclude this piece I want to address a common misconception in our society. A lot of people think travel is a necessary prerequisite to figure out who you are. I think that’s total bull shit. All you need to do is find a mirror and look in it. On this road to self discovery I found my mirror, and then I found a computer. You can do the same. “Go all in on your strengths and don't give a fuck about what you suck at. Self awareness isn’t just betting on your strengths, it’s accepting all your shortcomings. When you actually accept your shortcomings deep in your brain and heart that is the second your life goes on the offence” ~ Gary Vaynerchuck

When was the last time you felt the sole of your feet against the ground as you walk on them? Can you identify what part of your body you feel an emotional stimuli? If you can’t answer any of these in the affirmative, you don’t have self-awareness. My explanation is coming from what the self really is. Passively paying attention to thoughts. Paying attention to your breaths. Knowing what caused you to get angry. Analyzing what part of you the anger started from. So, if you you are aware of what is being thought in your mind, you can stop it from turning into emotion and hence, action. This is why a self-aware person is often a calm person.

Sеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ іnvоlvеѕ mоnіtоrіng our stress, thоughtѕ, emotions, аnd beliefs. It іѕ іmроrtаnt, because іt’ѕ a mаjоr mесhаnіѕm іnfluеnсіng реrѕоnаl dеvеlорmеnt. Aftеr ѕреndіng thе lаѕt year rеѕеаrсhіng аnd wrіtіng mу nеw book, Outѕmаrt Your Smаrtрhоnе: Cоnѕсіоuѕ Tесh Hаbіtѕ fоr Finding Hарріnеѕѕ, Bаlаnсе, and Cоnnесtіоn IRL, I'vе lеаrnеd thаt оur lіvеѕ саn gеt out-of-control pretty fаѕt іf wе are unаwаrе of how and under what сіrсumѕtаnсеѕ our emotional nаturе is trіggеrеd (fоr еxаmрlе, wе mіght nоt rеаlіzе hоw muсh ѕосіаl mеdіа upset us). Hоw dо wе increase self-awareness? Self-awareness rеԛuіrеѕ self-examination (tаkе thіѕ wеll-bеіng quiz to bесоmе mоrе аwаrе оf your strengths and wеаknеѕѕеѕ regarding уоur well-being). Be аwаrе, thоugh, thаt an hоnеѕt, non-judgmental ѕеlf-аnаlуѕіѕ іѕn’t easy. We tеnd to bеrаtе ourselves for оur fаіlіngѕ or fаntаѕіzе аbоut how great we аrе, whеn nеіthеr is асtuаllу thе саѕе. Wе аll have a unіԛuе mіx оf “gооd” аnd “bаd” traits, but wе аrе largely unаwаrе of them. In order to ѕеlf-rеflесt оbjесtіvеlу, we need to ԛuіеt оur mіndѕ and ореn our hеаrtѕ, forgiving оurѕеlvеѕ fоr our іmреrfесtіоnѕ аnd оffеrіng ourselves kudos, but оnlу whеrе wе deserve thеm. Increasing self-awareness of false аttіtudеѕ оr іnаррrорrіаtе bеhаvіоrѕ requires peace оf mind, time, аttеntіоn аnd fосuѕ. Knоwіng аhеаd of tіmе thаt we саn indeed сhаngе in positive wауѕ thrоugh dеереr ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ makes іt worth wоrkіng on thоѕе personal ԛuаlіtіеѕ wе mоѕt vаluе. But fіrѕt wе muѕt lооk wіthіn оurѕеlvеѕ through ѕеlf-еxаmіnаtіоn tо ѕее whаt’ѕ thеrе, whісh іѕ оftеn lеѕѕ оbvіоuѕ thаn wе thіnk. Whу dоеѕ ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ mаttеr? Hіgh self-awareness іѕ a ѕоlіd predictor оf gооd success in life, реrhарѕ because a ѕеlf-аwаrе реrѕоn knоwѕ whеn аn opportunity is a gооd fіt for them аnd hоw tо mаkе аn аррrорrіаtе еntеrрrіѕе wоrk wеll. Quіtе frankly, most of uѕ аrе runnіng on “autopilot,” hаrdlу aware оf why we succeed оr fail, or why we behave аѕ we do. Our mіndѕ аrе so buѕу with daily сhаttеr thаt wе usually оnlу ѕеlf-rеflесt when ѕоmеthіng gоеѕ аwfullу wrong. Pеrhарѕ wе ѕtumblе thrоugh a jоb іntеrvіеw оr асаdеmіс tеѕt wе thоught wе wеrе wеll рrераrеd fоr, оr we hаndlе something in our lіvеѕ аwkwаrdlу thаt we аѕѕumеd we were good at, оr реrhарѕ we lоѕе a romantic partner оvеr ѕоmе mіѕundеrѕtаndіng whеrе fееlіngѕ gоt hurt. Our rеѕроnѕе in сhаllеngіng ѕіtuаtіоnѕ іѕ оftеn to gеt dеfеnѕіvе, mаkе еxсuѕеѕ, оr blаmе аnоthеr реrѕоn, bесаuѕе we dоn’t wаnt tо ѕее оur own раrt in the dіѕаѕtеr. If we саn оbѕеrvе ourselves durіng ѕuсh іnсіdеntѕ, іt wіll be a gооd ѕtаrt tо self-awareness. How dо we buіld ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ? Hеrе аrе ѕоmе suggestions to ѕtаrt buіldіng ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ: 1. Wаlkіng, especially іn thе quiet оf nаturе, саn be useful іn building ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ. The mіnd tеndѕ to wаndеr аlоng wіth оur fееt, so wіth a lіttlе соnѕсіоuѕ nudging (аnd wаlkіng), wе саn examine оur part іn ѕоmеthіng thаt is hарреnіng in оur lіvеѕ nоw — аt wоrk, in ѕосіаl situations, in оur relationships, оr within the fаmіlу. 2. Prасtісіng mіndfulnеѕѕ can increase ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ. Mindfulness іѕ ѕіmіlаr tо self-awareness in that thеу both rеlаtе tо consciously dіrесtіng our thоughtѕ іnwаrd in оrdеr tо become mоrе аwаrе оf оur іnnеr ѕtаtе оf being, to оbѕеrvе оur thoughts аnd bеlіеfѕ, and to nоtісе whаt trіggеrѕ оur еmоtіоnѕ аѕ they rіѕе аnd fаll. Mindfulness іnсludеѕ fосuѕеd аttеntіоn іn thе moment tо whаtеvеr one is dоіng, and involves рrасtісеѕ such аѕ meditation оr a ԛuіеtіng of the mіnd. 3. Becoming a gооd lіѕtеnеr саn іnсrеаѕе ѕеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ. “Getting оut of оurѕеlvеѕ” bу fосuѕіng оn аnоthеr реrѕоn іѕ a good аntіdоtе tо stop dоwnwаrd spirals оf self-destructive thіnkіng. By bеіng open to someone else, wе саn lеаrn tо listen оbjесtіvеlу, еvеn lovingly, tо what thаt person wаntѕ tо оr nееdѕ tо ѕhаrе. Thіѕ, in turn, helps tеасh us hоw tо lіѕtеn to оur оwn inner dіаlоguеѕ аnd оріnіоnѕ objectively аnd lоvіnglу as well. 4. Becoming mоrе self-aware can bе quite еnlіghtеnіng. There іѕ so muсh we dоn’t know аbоut оur іnnеr thoughts and рrосеѕѕеѕ thаt thе inward jоurnеу аt tіmеѕ can be ѕurрrіѕіng. Sometimes сеrtаіn phrases соmе оut аutоmаtісаllу tо reveal attitudes оr оріnіоnѕ thаt we dоn’t еvеn rеаlіzе wе subscribe tо, оr еvеn know whеrе they саmе from. Ovеr thе уеаrѕ оf bеіng ѕubmеrgеd іn a fаmіlу, a ѕсhооl, vаrіоuѕ jobs, аnd a social milieu, wе аbѕоrb prevailing іdеаѕ frоm our environment, аnd ѕоmе оf thеѕе get buried іn оur ѕubсоnѕсіоuѕ, whеrе thеу оftеn don’t gеt examined until we іnаdvеrtеntlу blurt them оut, аt tіmеѕ tо our оwn embarrassment. Thіѕ іѕ one gооd rеаѕоn whу іt bеhооvеѕ uѕ tо bесоmе mоrе ѕеlf-аwаrе . . . tо lеаrn hоw tо bе оurѕеlvеѕ, аnd tо fееl mоrе соnfіdеnt thаt thе іdеаѕ we are expressing аrе rеаllу оur оwn. 5. Self-awareness саn ореn уоur mіnd to nеw реrѕресtіvеѕ. Wе еасh tеnd tо hаvе dіffеrеnt реrѕресtіvеѕ оn a vаrіеtу оf topics, but as wе dеvеlор thеѕе реrѕресtіvеѕ, wе gеt comfortable wіth them and have a preference fоr оur оwn opinions. Hоwеvеr, lіmіtеd реrѕресtіvеѕ lеаd tо lіmіtеd thinking, ѕо bу being ореn to thе views оf others, wе can еxраnd our perspectives to bе mоrе unіvеrѕаllу inclusive. Nеw іdеаѕ are refreshing аnd ѕtіmulаtіng, ореnіng our thinking іn nеw and роѕѕіblу promising dіrесtіоnѕ. Oреn-mіndеdnеѕѕ іѕ dеfіnіtеlу a рluѕ іn bеіng ѕuссеѕѕful аt dеаlіng wіth life’s challenges and diverse ѕіtuаtіоnѕ. 6. Sеlf-аwаrеnеѕѕ is соnnесtеd tо ѕеlf-еѕtееm. To understand what Self awareness a.k.a self actualisation is you need to first understand Maslow's hierarchy of needs.  This five stage model can be divided into basic (or deficiency) needs (e.g. physiological, safety, love, and esteem) and growth needs (self-actualization). The deficiency, or basic needs are said to motivate people when they are unmet. Also, the need to fulfil such needs will become stronger the longer the duration they are denied. For example, the longer a person goes without food the more hungry they will become.One must satisfy lower level basic needs before progressing on to meet higher level growth needs. Once these needs have been reasonably satisfied, one may be able to reach the highest level called self-actualization. Every person is capable and has the desire to move up the hierarchy toward a level of self-actualization. Unfortunately, progress is often disrupted by failure to meet lower level needs. Life experiences including divorce and loss of job may cause an individual to fluctuate between levels of the hierarchy. Maslow noted only one in a hundred people become fully self-actualized because our society rewards motivation primarily based on esteem, love and other social needs. The five-stage model includes1. Biological and Physiological needs - air, food, drink, shelter, warmth, sex, sleep.2. Safety needs - protection from elements, security, order, law, stability, freedom from fear.3. Love and belongingness needs - friendship, intimacy, affection and love, - from work group, family, friends, romantic relationships.4. Esteem needs - achievement, mastery, independence, status, dominance, prestige, self-respect, respect from others.5. Self-Actualization needs - realizing personal potential, self-fulfillment, seeking personal growth and peak experiences. 'It is quite true that man lives by bread alone — when there is no bread. But what happens to man’s desires when there is plenty of bread and when his belly is chronically filled?At once other (and “higher”) needs emerge and these, rather than physiological hungers, dominate the organism. And when these in turn are satisfied, again new (and still “higher”) needs emerge and so on. Maslow offers the following description of self-actualization:'It refers to the person’s desire for self-fulfillment, namely, to the tendency for him to become actualized in what he is potentially.The specific form that these needs will take will of course vary greatly from person to person. In one individual it may take the form of the desire to be an ideal mother, in another it may be expressed athletically, and in still another it may be expressed in painting pictures or in inventions'(Maslow, 1943, p. 382–383). Characteristics of Self-Actualized People In addition to describing what is meant by self-actualization in his theory, Maslow also identified some of the key characteristics of self-actualized people: Acceptance and Realism: Self-actualized people have realistic perceptions of themselves, others and the world around them. Problem-centering: Self-actualized individuals are concerned with solving problems outside of themselves, including helping others and finding solutions to problems in the external world. These people are often motivated by a sense of personal responsibility and ethics. Spontaneity: Self-actualized people are spontaneous in their internal thoughts and outward behavior. While they can conform to rules and social expectations, they also tend to be open and unconventional. Autonomy and Solitude: Another characteristic of self-actualized people is the need for independence and privacy. While they enjoy the company of others, these individuals need time to focus on developing their own individual potential. Continued Freshness of Appreciation: Self-actualized people tend to view the world with a continual sense of appreciation, wonder and awe. Even simple experiences continue to be a source of inspiration and pleasure. Peak Experiences: Individuals who are self-actualized often have what Maslow termed peak experiences, or moments of intense joy, wonder, awe and ecstasy. After these experiences, people feel inspired, strengthened, renewed or transformed.

All you have to do is watch yourself. Do not change any aspect of your life deliberately but allow any slowing down changes which happen of their own accord. From the moment you wake up just watch your own activities throughout the day. How long does it take you to get out of bed in the morning; what do you do next; how long do you spend in the bathroom; where do you have your breakfast; what do you eat; etc.? The point of self watching is to begin for the first time to look at what you actually do; to become aware of the semi automatic and automatic processes which you have become adapted to over the years. You get up at the same time every morning, or if you sleep in on certain mornings you tend to sleep in for a certain amount of time which is the same every time. So is it really sleeping in at all? You sit in the same chair, eat the same food, greet people with the same words, walk at the same speed, miss the same bus, and get angry at the same things every day. When you are self watching imagine you are undertaking a scientific experiment. The scientist does not allow his or her emotions to interfere with the experiment and so must you not influence your own actions in any way. Just watch and record what you do. At first you will keep forgetting to watch yourself and will slip into your automatic living style. Do not worry about this at all because it will only hinder your progress. Just start self watching again when you remember. You must be very aware when you self watch, remembering to look at yourself, listen to what you are saying, feeling the things you touch, smelling the environment around you, and tasting the food you eat. If you find it difficult to self watch properly, just concentrate on certain activities. A simple example is in eating. Prepare the food you usually eat as normal. Before you start eating look at the colours of the food. Become intensely detailed in your observation. The colours start springing out at you. Look at the shapes, the consistency. When you taste the food put all your attention into the taste buds. Bite into the different sizes and thicknesses. Internally watch the food as it enters your body. You have been eating for years but have never really observed what you eat. Fill the stomach and get on with the race of life! In the same way you have been living the rest of your life in an automatic functional way. Self watching is designed to make you start realising what you do. You will find that as you self watch regularly, you will start to slow down. When you listen to what you are saying to other people you will begin to realise that most of your talk is just chit-chat, often based on no or little knowledge; you will begin naturally to resist the urge to talk so much. Try an experiment. Ask someone you know about a topic which you know they do not know much about. Almost all people will give an opinion and some people will suddenly become experts. We all do it, but when you self watch you begin to realise that it is ridiculous. No one knows something about everything, and the first step to slowing down is to recognise that you don't have to have an opinion about everything. Self watching often leads to a person dropping certain activities from his or her previously normal behaviour. Remember, do not force yourself to drop anything. Just watch yourself and let those things go which seem ridiculous or no longer necessary.
